editor.collabToolsSoon:
Collab tools allow you to visualize parts of a collab. When setup properly, the list will show a graph with the lengths of a part, what the member did in the collab, their GD icon and socials.
Collabs are made in the Editor. The Collab Editor can be opened with the button beside the creator input.
Create a new collab by pressing "Create collab". After starting a collab. the role sidebar will be opened. Preset roles can be accessed with the arrow in the top right corner.
To add a member, click the green plus icon. The name input box will be focused automatically. After typing out the name, you can smash Enter, or click the search icon. This will automatically fetch the member's GD icon a socials. After the search, you can press Enter again to add another member. My man, I'm sure you can figure out the rest lmao :D.
editor.listBGhelp:
# Settings
*Coverage - Changes the height of the background.
*Alignment - If the screen's aspect ratio is narrower than the background, the background will be aligned.
*Gradient - If a gradient with the list color should be placed over the background.
There's a green box in the image preview that you can drag and select the part of the background you want to show.

List backgrounds work best with translucent cards!
editor.levelSearchHelp:
# Searching by ID
*The search icon next to the level ID will fetch level info of a level with the given ID
# Searching by name/creator
The search icon between the level name and level author will fetch
*The most liked level with the **given name**
*The most recent level from the **given author**
*If both fields are fille in, **the level from the given author**

settingsMenu.delDataHelp: DELETES ALL page data. This includes draft posts; saved levels, collabs; external images etc.
settingsMenu.flipControlsHelp: The close button and dialog headers will move to the bottom on mobile devices.
settingsMenu.colorizeHelp: The color of a post will adapt to a selected background image.
settingsMenu.compactHelp: Hides tool names in the editor.
settingsMenu.draftNoRemove: Do Not Remove Draft after Upload
settingsMenu.saveThumbsHelp: Searching a level will save its thumbnail to the Gallery. Disable to speed up search.

help.listEditsHelp:
You can edit a list on the list page by clicking 'Edit'. 
The list can be deleted in the editor. 
To edit the list, you must be logged in to the account that uploaded the list.
help.listPinHelp:
If you come back to a list often, you can pin it and it will appear on the homepage. 
You can have up to 5 pinned lists at once.
help.privListsHelp:
Private lists are not displayed publicly and you can only access them with a special link. 
You can edit them at any time and make them public.
help.translucentHelp:
When turned on, level cards will be translucent in the list. 
Translucent cards work best with some sort of list background.
help.formatHelp:
Text formatting uses GFM (GitHub Flavoured Markdown).

In the Formatting dropdown, you can find help on how to use GFM.

If you don't want to use Markdown, you can disable it in the paragraph's settings.
help.containerHelp:
Elements for images, videos etc. are next to the buttons for aligning.

Click on an element to select it. Every element has it's own settings, under the cogwheel button in the top-right edge of the element.

**Middle-clicking** the settings button will remove the element.
Hold **SHIFT** while adding an element to add it **above** the selected element.

You can have up to a 100 visual/text elements in the review.
help.columnHelp:
Columns allow you to have text text and most other elements next to each other.

To add content to a column, click on it first to select it. A selected column's outline is thicker.

After selecting a column, the "Add column" button wil turn into an edit button, where you can manage the layout.

You can have up to 10 columns next to each other. Columns overflow when there isn't enough room for the content.

By default, columns try filling as much space as possible. In the column settings, you can limit a column's width to it's content's width.

Tip: If all columns are width limited, you can center the entire layout with the align buttons.

If the layout has 2 columns and you remove one, the other column's content will be transferred back into the review.
help.diffGuessHelp:
If Difficulty Guessing is turned on, the list will gradually unlock as you guess difficulties, ratings, or both.
*In the List Browser, these lists have question marks in the background.
*If coming from Saved Levels, guessing will not be triggered.
*You can use the arrow keys to play.

reviews.draftHelp2: You can save and come back to these posts anytime.
reviews.draftHelp3:
Drafts are used to store your unfinished reviews.\
\
Reviews save by themselves depending on your set autosave interval, or when you leave the page.\
\
Drafts are saved locally. Any saves you make are on this device only and they'll get deleted when clearing cookies. You can save even if the servers or your internet is down.\
\
The draft is removed once you upload your review.
